concept.title: Scenarios
concept.shortdesc: Scenarios can be based on use cases or samples. They describe the way a set of product features would get used in a real-life situation.

conbody.p: If there are already use cases or samples defined for your product, you can use them as a starting point, although their usefulness will depend on how closely they map to actual use models. Use cases are a typical starting point for many product design efforts, and samples can be viewed in many cases as the output from an implicit use case.

Typically, you want something that reflects a real-world situation, and that can be tied back to the real requirements for the product. That way, you can make sure that your documentation reflects the real needs of your users, rather than just describing a list of features.

Scenarios can be used as input for creating tutorials and samples, and for identifying tasks through task analysis. They can also be a subject of documentation in their own right, using a mix of concepts with tasks, written in the third person, in a mixed type document.
